intro: Phyteuma orbiculare var. bracteosum, commonly known as the bracteate phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. The flowers, which bloom in late summer, range in color from pale blue to lilac and are adorned with distinctive bracts that enhance its ornamental appeal.
